items.title: [FFI] Dispose ServiceProvider on window close to prevent native handle leak
items.description: EngineWrapper is registered as a singleton IDisposable but the ServiceProvider is never disposed at app exit. sd_engine_destroy() is never called and the native _handle leaks on every shutdown. Add a MainWindow.Closed handler that calls (App.Services as IDisposable)?.Dispose() to propagate Dispose() to all singleton disposables including EngineWrapper and DatabaseService.
acceptanceCriteria: MainWindow.Closed handler calls (App.Services as IDisposable)?.Dispose()
sd_engine_destroy() is confirmed called on window close (visible via debug output or native debugger)
No live super_duper_ffi handles remain after process exit (verified with handles.exe or WinDbg)
items.notes: Files: App.xaml.cs:71; NativeMethods/EngineWrapper.cs:388-399. Effort: XS. Must be fixed before 002 since both modify the same Closed handler.

items.title: [FFI] Add CancellationToken + await to prevent Dispose race during active scan
items.description: If the user closes the window mid-scan, MainWindow.Closed calls Dispose() on the UI thread while the scan thread holds a live _handle. The _disposed check is not inside a lock, so sd_engine_destroy() can execute while the scan thread is mid-call into native code — undefined behavior with potential heap corruption. Add CancelAndWaitAsync() to ScanService and update the Closed handler to cancel + await the scan before disposing services.
acceptanceCriteria: ScanService exposes CancelAndWaitAsync() that cancels the scan and awaits the running scan Task
MainWindow.Closed handler awaits CancelAndWaitAsync() before calling (App.Services as IDisposable)?.Dispose()
Starting a large scan and immediately closing the window produces no heap corruption or access violation under AppVerifier
items.notes: Files: NativeMethods/EngineWrapper.cs:388-399; Services/ScanService.cs:156. Effort: M.

items.title: [ASYNC] Offload ExecuteDeletion() to background thread to unblock UI
items.description: DeletionReviewViewModel.ExecuteDeletion() calls _engine.ExecuteDeletionPlan(UseTrash) synchronously on the UI thread. For large deletion lists this produces a visible freeze. Rename to ExecuteDeletionAsync(), wrap the FFI call in Task.Run(), set IsExecuting flag, and update the caller in DeletionReviewPage.xaml.cs to await it.
acceptanceCriteria: ExecuteDeletion() is renamed to ExecuteDeletionAsync() returning Task
FFI call _engine.ExecuteDeletionPlan(UseTrash) is wrapped in Task.Run()
IsExecuting is set to true before and false in finally
DeletionReviewPage.xaml.cs caller awaits ExecuteDeletionAsync()
Window remains movable and responsive while deleting a large file list
items.notes: Files: ViewModels/DeletionReviewViewModel.cs:84-110; Views/DeletionReviewPage.xaml.cs. Effort: S.

items.title: [PERF] Forward PropertyName in ScanProgressOverlay instead of broadcasting all 7 properties
items.description: ScanProgressOverlay's PropertyChanged handler ignores the PropertyName argument and raises all 7 PropertyChanged events on every tick. During Phase 2 (checksumming), the Rust core fires a progress callback per file — potentially hundreds per second — each triggering 7 binding re-evaluations. Forward the specific PropertyName instead, only broadcasting all when PropertyName is null.
acceptanceCriteria: PropertyChanged handler in ScanProgressOverlay.xaml.cs uses e.PropertyName to forward the specific change
All-properties broadcast only fires when e.PropertyName is null (ObservableObject convention for bulk refresh)
During an active scan, debug output or profiler shows ~7x fewer PropertyChanged events per tick
items.notes: File: Controls/ScanProgressOverlay.xaml.cs:38-50. Effort: XS.

items.title: [PERF] Replace FFI page query in RefreshMetricsAsync with a SQL aggregate query
items.description: DashboardViewModel.RefreshMetricsAsync marshals up to 500 DuplicateGroupInfo structs across the FFI boundary purely to sum WastedBytes — orders of magnitude more expensive than a single SQL aggregate. Add GetSessionMetricsAsync(long sessionId) to IDatabaseService using COUNT(*)/SUM(wasted_bytes) and replace the FFI call.
acceptanceCriteria: IDatabaseService gains GetSessionMetricsAsync(long sessionId) returning (int groupCount, long wastedBytes)
DatabaseService implements it with a single SQL SELECT COUNT(*), COALESCE(SUM(wasted_bytes),0) WHERE session_id = @sessionId
DashboardViewModel.RefreshMetricsAsync calls the new DB method instead of QueryDuplicateGroups(0, 500)
Dashboard metrics display correctly after the change
items.notes: Files: ViewModels/DashboardViewModel.cs:270; Services/IDatabaseService.cs; Services/DatabaseService.cs. Effort: S.

items.title: [PERF] Apply debounce guard to StorageTreemap SizeChanged to prevent concurrent renders
items.description: TreemapCanvas_SizeChanged fires _ = RenderAsync() on every pixel of resize without the _renderPending guard that exists for the collection-changed path. Multiple Task.Run squarify computations race to write to TreemapCanvas.Children, causing visual tearing. Apply the same debounce pattern used in the collection-changed path to SizeChanged.
acceptanceCriteria: TreemapCanvas_SizeChanged checks _renderPending before firing RenderAsync()
Rapid window resize does not spawn multiple concurrent RenderAsync() tasks
No visual tearing or stale renders during resize
_renderPending is correctly reset after each render cycle
items.notes: File: Controls/StorageTreemap.xaml.cs:71-74. Effort: XS.

items.title: [PERF] Replace outer ItemsRepeater in GroupsPage with a virtualizing control
items.description: GroupsPage uses a non-virtualizing ItemsRepeater for the outer group list. With 1000+ groups or many simultaneously expanded groups, all UI elements are instantiated and held live, consuming significant memory and render time. The paged LoadMore partially mitigates but does not eliminate the problem once many pages load. Replace with ListView or configure RecyclingElementFactory.
acceptanceCriteria: Outer group list uses a virtualizing control (ListView or ItemsRepeater with RecyclingElementFactory + StackLayout)
Memory usage with 1000+ groups is measurably lower than the non-virtualizing baseline
Group expand/collapse behavior is preserved
Paged LoadMore command continues to work correctly
items.notes: File: Views/GroupsPage.xaml. Effort: L. Inner per-file ItemsRepeater is bounded by group size and is lower priority.

items.title: [SECURITY] Pin DLL load path with NativeLibrary.SetDllImportResolver to prevent DLL planting
items.description: DllImport("super_duper_ffi") without an explicit path uses the standard Windows DLL search order. If the app is run from a user-writable directory, a local DLL planting attack could substitute a malicious super_duper_ffi.dll. Register a DllImportResolver in the App constructor that pins loading to AppContext.BaseDirectory.
acceptanceCriteria: NativeLibrary.SetDllImportResolver registered in App() constructor for typeof(SuperDuperEngine).Assembly
Resolver loads exclusively from Path.Combine(AppContext.BaseDirectory, "super_duper_ffi.dll")
App starts correctly with the pinned resolver active
A DLL placed in the working directory is not loaded in place of the one in the app directory
items.notes: Files: NativeMethods/SuperDuperEngine.cs:12; App.xaml.cs constructor. Effort: S.
